trail_name: Red Castle Lake via East Fork Smiths Fork

review.name: Lorenzo
review.body: This trail is pretty easy going to start off. Once you get about 4 miles in it gets pretty steep, but it is worth the time!

description: This is a relatively easy trail that gives a view of Salt Lake City looking South.

review.name: Parker
review.body: The view is awesome. You can see Salt Lake City from above, and the Wasatch mountains.

trail_name: Kings Peak via Henry's Fork Trail
description: This trail is about 13.8 miles from Trailhead to Kings Peak, it takes you up above 13,500 feet. It's the highest peak in Utah.

review.name: Brenner
review.body: I finally summited Kings Peak, and I must say the hike was fantastic.

review.name: Patrick
review.body: This was a really cool hike. There's so much to see up here, beautiful lakes and meadows all around.

trail_name: Mt Ogden via Beus Canyon Trailhead
description: This trail climbs up Beus Canyon, where it intersects the Bonneville Shoreline Trail. The trail continues along Beus Canyon

review.name: Sally
review.body: I love this trail. It is fairly difficult, so make sure you practice other trails first. The views of the Wasatch Front and the Ogden Valley/Huntsville area is breathtaking.

description: A very popular trail, about 3 miles out and back. There's a really cool waterfall at the end.

review.name: Steve
review.body: This is a nice trail for beginners, it does get kinda crowded so go in the early morning or late afternoon.

description: Near the Snow Basin ski area, this trail is a great hike for families. It features a stream, and towering cliffs
This is a moderate trail, about 9 miles out and back. It gradually ascends up the canyon as you encounter pine forest and meadows. The lake is in a bowl surrounded by towering peaks.
